Description: Head of terracotta statuette, solid, broken at neck: crudely hand-modelled facial features, tall, flat, flaring headdress. Light yellow-pinkish porous clay. Black paint around eyes, hairline and two bands around neck (necklace? dress edge?); on front of headdress horizontal red stripe framed by two bands of black.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ.(?) (likely)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Though many close parallels exist (particularly the flat-chested types from Yeroskipou-Monagri in Karageorghis 1998, 15-17, pls 8.7-11 Types I(i)77-80), the goddess with uplifted arms type continued from the ‘11th down to the early 5th centuries BC, with very few changes’ (ibid. 17). This example is most likely from the Cypro-Archaic II period. See also British Museum EA 50121. Archaic pieces with very similar painted decoration and form from Paphos (Leibundgut Wieland & Frey-Asche 2011, 19, pl.12, nos 13, 14, 15, 16). Under the number 1911.44, a mixed batch of objects were originally registered; the sub-numbers were assigned on 11.5.2000. A number of Cypriot terracotta and limestone figures were sent by the Egypt Exploration Fund in 1911 to the British Museum and various other museums including this one. Many of these were labelled T, Φ, or TAΦ, followed by a context number, designating these as coming from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, from Gardner’s excavations in 1885-1886. This is also confirmed by British Museum registers. This figure is from this group and so highly likely to have been excavated within the temenos of the Aphrodite sanctuary. Faded and unclear pencil mark on back Karageorghis, V. 1998. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. VI. The Cypro-Archaic period small female figurines. Nicosia, University of Cyprus. Leibundgut Wieland, D. & Frey-Asche, L. 2011. Weihgeschenke aus dem Heiligtum der Aphrodite in Alt-Paphos : Terrakotten, Skulplturen und andere figürliche Kleinvotive. DAI. Mainz.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.003) (Phase 1)
